full_text: BP-A0383 AUG 11 INMATE PERSONAL PROPERTY RECORD CDFRM U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE FEDERAL BUREAU OF PRISON Institution MCC NY 1. Name EPSTEIN, JEFFREY 2. Register No. 76318-054 3. Unit 4. Date & Time of Intake 7-15-2019 9:00AM 5. Purpose of Inventory (Check one that applies): Date and Time of Action 7.6.3.18.054 a ___ Admission b ___ Hospital c ___ Writ d ___ Transfer e ___ Detention f ___ Release g ___ Incoming Package h ___ Other (specify) 6. Disposition (Disp.) D-Donated M-Mail S-Storage K-Keep in Possession C-Contraband (Attach BP-S102) 7. Type of Property: a. Personally Owned Items Disp. # Article Disp. # Article Disp. # Article Disp. b. Hygiene, etc. c. Hobby craft d. Food e. Miscellaneous (List any damaged property and from where it was received: e.g. U.S. Marshal) Address Book Batteries Belt Billfold Books, Reading hard/soft Books, Religious hard/soft Boot Brassiere Cap, Hat Coat Comb Combination Lock Dress Eyeglass Case Eyeglasses Gloves Hairbrush/Pick Handkerchief Headphones Laundry Jacket Laundry Detergent Legal Materials Letters Magazines Mirror Nail Clippers Pen/Ballpoint Pencils Personal Papers Photo Album Photo Plastic Bowl Plastic Spoon, spn Mastic spoon cup Playing Cards Purse Radio (w/earplug) Religious Medal Shirt/Blouse Shoes Shoes, shower Shoes, Slippers Skirt Slip Socks Socks, Athletic Stamps Stockings Sunglasses Sweat pants T-Shirt Sweat Shirt Thermal Bottom Thermal Top Underwear Watch/Wristband Aspirin Body Soap Cotton Swabs Deodorant Dental Floss Dentures Power Hair Oil Petroleum Jelly Mentholatum Razor Shampoo Shaving Lotion Skin Lotion Soap Dish Toothbrush Toothbrush Holder Toothpaste Tweezers Bran Cake Candy Chips Coffee/tea Cold drink mix, soda Cough Drops Fish Packs Fruit Honey, Hi-protein Instant Coffee/Instant Chocolate Mayonnaise Oatmeal Pepperoni Noodles Rice Sausage Spices Tea Vitamins Article Disp. Article Disp. 8. Items Alleged by Inmate to Have Value Over $100.00 Description of Property Value Alleged by Inmate No individual item over $100.00 JEFFREY 9. Article(s) listed as "Mail" (M) Are to be forwarded to (Name and Address of Consignee): 10. Claim Release: a. The receiving officer, as soon as possible after receipt of the property as possible, will review the inventory with the inmate to verify its accuracy. Property that is stored, kept in possession of the inmate mailed out of the institution, or donated is to be marked in the appropriate section of this inventory form. The receiving officer certifies receipt, review and disposition of the property by signing below. The inmate by signing below certifies the accuracy of the inventory, except as noted on the form, relinquishing of all claim to articles listed as donated, receipt of all allowable items, and receipt of a copy of the inventory. When the inmate claims a discrepancy in the inventory, the receiving officer shall attempt to resolve the discrepancy. If the inmate states that there is missing or damaged property, this information should be noted under COMMENTS. COMMENTS: (b)(6), (b)(7)(C) Printed Name/Signature of Receiving Officer: I have today reviewed the property returned to me. Signature of Inmate Date: 7-15-19 Time: 900 76318.054 7-15-19 900 Register # Date Time b. Upon release of the inmate from the unit, detention, etc., the releasing officer is to give the inmate that property stored as a result of the inmate's housing. The inmate certifies release of the property, except as noted on this form, and receipt of a copy of the inventory by signing below. When the inmate claims a discrepancy in the inventory, the releasing officer shall attempt to resolve the discrepancy. If the inmate states that there is missing or damaged property, this information should be noted under COMMENTS. COMMENTS: Printed Name/Signature of Receiving Officer: I have today reviewed the property returned to me. Signature of Inmate Date: Time: Register # Date Time Original: Central File: Copy: Inmate. R&D. Special Housing Prescribed by P5510 Replace of BP-S383 of AUG 94 DOJ-OGR-00027126

additional_notes: The document is a scanned copy of an Inmate Personal Property Record form. It contains handwritten information about the inmate's personal property, including items such as clothing, hygiene products, and food. The form is signed by the inmate and a receiving officer. There are no visible redactions or damage to the document.
